name: 劉亮志
objective: This course will shed light on the methodology for evaluating derivatives, hedging and managing investment risk. The pricing algorithm will be implemented in C language and Matlab. The problems that will be dealt with include the approximation of internal rates of returns via the bisection and Newton method,  and the calculation of spot rate curves via the bootstrap method.

Week 1   :  Course Introduction and Preliminary
Week 2   :  The Tool for Coding C Language and MATLAB  
Week 3   :  If /Else Structure and For/While Loop 
Week 4   :  Cash Flow Evaluation / Bisection and Newton Method-1
Week 5   :  Cash Flow Evaluation / Bisection and Newton Method-2
Week 6   :  Cash Flow Evaluation / Bisection and Newton Method-3 
Week 7   :  Cash Flow Evaluation / Bisection and Newton Method-4 
Week 8   :  Mid-Term Review and Exercise                      
Week 9   :  Matrix
Week 10 :  Introduction to Interest Rates / Bootstrap Method-1
Week 11 :  Introduction to Interest Rates / Bootstrap Method-2   
Week 12 :  Introduction to Interest Rates / Bootstrap Method-3 
Week 13 :  Introduction to Interest Rates / Bootstrap Method-4
Week 14 :  Bond Price Volatility and Hedge-1
Week 15 :  Bond Price Volatility and Hedge-2
Week 16 :  Bond Price Volatility and Hedge-3  
Week 17 :  Take-Home Final Term 
Week 18 :  Course Review
materials: Options, Futures, and Other Derivatives, by J. C. Hull, 8TH Edition, Prentice Hall
